intro: Corispermum mongolicum, commonly known as the Mongolian corispermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing, annual herb that typically thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are narrow and linear. It is native to regions of Central Asia, including Mongolia and parts of China. Corispermum mongolicum is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its natural habitat.
